step1.sentence: A broken traffic signal held up the morning commute for over an hour.

step2.story: The delivery was supposed to arrive by noon, but a customs issue held it up for two extra days. The client was disappointed but understanding.

step3.story: The entire film production was held up for a week when the lead actress caught a cold. Sets were built, costumes were ready, and the crew waited with nothing to do. The director used the time to rework a few scenes in the script. When filming finally resumed, some of the changes turned out to be improvements.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 진행이나 이동을 지연시키다; 버티거나 잘 견디다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 배송, 교통, 일정 등이 지연될 때 씁니다. 또는 어려운 상황에서 잘 버틴다는 뜻으로도 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: hold(잡다, 유지하다)와 up(위로, 앞으로)이 결합하여 앞으로 나아가지 못하게 잡아두거나 버틴다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 지연의 의미로 쓸 때는 수동적으로 발생하는 상황에 자주 씁니다. 잘 버티다의 뜻으로도 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Sorry I'm late; the traffic held me up for almost forty minutes.
